channel.title: Week of Awesome 2025 on Carleton Computer Science Society
channel.description: Recent content in Week of Awesome 2025 on Carleton Computer Science Society

item.title: Tech Club Expo
item.description: Featuring: Carleton Blueprint Carleton CUSEC Society Cybersecurity Club CU Game Dev Club cuHacking CU InSpace CU Math and Stat Society Technolgap WiCS - Women in Computer Science

item.title: Board Games Night
item.description: Purchase a ticket for the event for $12.25 here: Board Games Night Tickets We cannot accommodate walk-ins, so make sure to secure your spot before tickets run out! Also keep the confirmation email for your ticket purchase on hand for the event. Meet us in the CCSS Lounge - Herzberg 4135 - by 4:45 PM if you would like to bus over with a group, or you can meet us there.

item.title: Future of Tech Careers: How You Can Get Ahead
25 Years of Computers and Telecommunications
item.description: Join Carleton CS alum Chris Bark as he talks about his 25-year career in computers and telecommunications. He has worked for Palm, Amazon, BlackBerry, and Apple. Chris will also share the goals, challenges, and technologies at his current place of employment, SSi Canada; a company that aims to make technologies more accessible to remote and rural communities across Canada.

item.title: Fall General Meeting
item.description: Learn about everything we do, the various events and initiatives we have coming up, and how you can get involved as a volunteer! We will also be voting on some constitution changes. Link -> Proposed CCSS Constitution Changes September 2025

item.title: Amazing Race: Carleton
item.description: Take on our Amazing Race challenges in teams of up to 5 as you explore Carleton’s campus! We‚Äôll be using Discord for communication and challenge submissions ‚Äî make sure to join our server before the event -> CCSS Discord Server

item.title: Daily Code Challenges
item.description: From September 7th - 13th, new code challenges will be releasing every day at midnight! Check them out here -> CCSS Code Challenges
